a.title: A Message From The Class of 2020

div.a: A Message From The Class of 2020

strong.span: Message from Superintendent Oftedahl regarding the Coronavirus:

img.p:
During a press conference today, Governor Walz made announcements concerning the remainder of the school year. Distance learning, which we have been participating in for the past month, will be extended through the end of the school year. This means that students will not be returning to the school building this spring, but that we will continue to share content and materials through our distance learning platforms.
Details of the plan for Luverne Public Schools include:
We will follow our previously approved calendar with a small number of exceptions
May 22, will still be the final day for student learning and the end of our fourth quarter
May 1 and May 4 will NOT be student days and are set aside for teacher professional development as directed by the Governors order.
Daycare for families of emergency workers will continue to be open as it has been over the past month
Meal delivery for families will continue as it has over the past month
We understand that there are many questions about school activities and events that would traditionally take place at the end of the school year. As of today, this is the information that we have concerning events:
Prom, which was previously postponed, has been cancelled for 2020.
High School Academic Awards Night will be hosted on May 11, in a virtual format.
Graduation will be held in some format on May 24. Details concerning the format will be determined over the coming weeks.
As the situation concerning COVID-19 continues to evolve we know that there are questions concerning how school and activities are effected. What we are sharing today is based on the announcement made today. As more details become available we will share information as soon as possible.
Craig Oftedahl
Superintendent of Schools
Luverne Public Schools
img.br:
Please see the resources below for information about the disease.

div.p: Luverne Schools will engage students in lifelong learning to achieve their maximum potential in becoming productive citizens.
